description.en: This course overviews: a) Theory of granulation and pelletisation (mechanisms of granule/pellet formation), b) Materials characterization relevant to granulation processing, c) Spray drying, d) Supercritical fluid technology, e) High-shear, fluid-bed and roller compaction technologies, f) Process end-point detection in granulations, g) Pelletisation techniques, h) Tablet compression and bond formation, i) Compression equations, force-displacement /force-time treatments and stress relaxation, j) Instrumentation of tablet machines, and k) PAT/PIT issues related to granulation and tableting.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate: a) granulatsiooni ja pelletite moodustumise teooriast, b) granulatsioonil kasutatavate oluliste materjalide iseloomustamisest, c) pihustuskuivatamisest, d) superktiitilise vedeliku tehnoloogiast, e) kõrgnihke granulatsiooni, fluidisatsiooni ja valtspress granulatsiooni tehnoloogiatest, f) granulatsiooniprotsessi lõpp-punkti määramisest, g) pelletite tootmise tehnoloogiast, h) tabletide pressimisest ja pressitavate osakeste vahel sidemete moodustumisest, i) tablettide pressimisel olulistest valemitest...j) tableteerimisel kasutatavatest aparaatidest, k)granultsiooni ja tableteerimise PAT-ist ja PIT-ist.

objectives.en: This course is aiming to provide an advanced level of knowledge on pharmaceutical wet and dry granulation technologies (including pelletisation) and tablet compression. More specifically, the course will cover granule and pellet formation and growth mechanisms, granulation process control and measuring systems, granulation PAT/PIT, tablet compression equations and parameters, and final product characterization of granules and tablets.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda kursusle osalejatele kõrgel tasemel teadmisi farmaatsias kasutatavate kuiv- ja märggranuleerimisetenoloogiatest (kaasa arvatud pelletite tootmise tehnoloogiast) ja tabletide pressimisest. Kursus käsitleb graanulite ja pelletite moodustumise ja kasvamise mehhanisme, granulatsiooniprotsessi kontrollli ja monitoorimise süsteeme, granulatsiooni PAT-i ja PIT-i, tablettide pressimise parameetreid ja tabletide pressimise teooria valemeid ning granulatsiooni ja tableteerimise lõpproduktide iseloomustamist.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course:
- knows theory of granulation and pelletisation
- knows basic methods and techniques in particle formation
learning_outcomes.et: - osakeste moodustumise peamisi meetodeid ja tehnikaid

learning_outcomes.en: - knows basic methods for pharmaceutical dry and wet granulation and pelletisation
learning_outcomes.et: - farmatseutilise kuiva ja märja granuleerimise põhimeetodeid

learning_outcomes.en: - knows theory of consolidation and bond formation in tablet compression
learning_outcomes.et: - tableti pressimisel osakeste ja molekulide tasemel toimuvate muutuste teooriat

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the most commonly used tablet compression parameters and equations
learning_outcomes.et: - tableti pressimise põhiparameetreid ja tableti pressimise teooria põhivalemeid

learning_outcomes.en: - understand the significance of PAT/PIT in granulation, pelletisation and tableting
learning_outcomes.et: - PAT-i ja PIT-i olulisust granuleerimises pelletite moodustumises ja tableteerimises.

A - Excellent (91-100%):	The student shows an excellent knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers are exceptionally well and precisely compiled, logically presented, and correct. The language is also perfect.

topic area and substance. The anwers are well written  and mainly correct. The language is also good without any significant flaws.   
 
C - Good (71-80%): 	The student shows a good knowledge on the course  topic area and substance. The anwers are quite well compiled and mainly correct. The language is also quite good with only some flaws.   

D - Satisfactory (61-70%):	The student shows satisfactory knowledge on the  course topic area and substance. The anwers contain  some siginificant deficiences and flaws. The language is only fair to passable with clear mistakes.   

E - Passable (51-60%): 	The student shows only a fair and passable knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain many deficiences. The language is quite poor with numerous flaws.   

F - Rejected (0-50%): 	The student shows very poor knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain numerous significant flaws and deficiences. The language is very poor with numerous flaws.

description.et:
The 1st lecture:
Powder state and properties
Theory of granulation
Mechanisms of granule formation
Materials characterization and selection

The 2nd lecture:
Spray drying
Supercritical fluid technology
Low and high-shear wet granulation
Fluid-bed granulation
End-point detection in wet granulation

The 3rd lecture:
Effervescent granules
Dry granulation 
Roller compaction technology

The 4th lecture:
Pelletisation technology
Extrusion-spheronisation
Centrifugal 
Hot-melt

The 5th lecture:
Tablet compression as a phenomenon 
Inter-molecular bond formation in tableting
Compression equations (Heckel, Cooper-Eaton, Kawakita)
Force-displacement and force-time treatments 
Stress relaxation

The 6th lecture.
Instrumentation of tableting machines
Compaction simulator
Tablet characterization and quality tests

The 7th lecture:
PAT in pharmaceutical granulation and tableting. Solid-state incompatibilities, PITs

The 8th lecture.
Surface engineering of powder particles 
Thin coating of powders, granules and tablets

Seminar: 
In the final seminar session, there will be 15-20 min student presentations based on research articles in pharmaceutical granulation, pelletisation and tableting.
